sentence.Network_en: We must avoid the damaging boom-bust cycles which characterised the 1980s.
sentence.Network_cn: 我们必须避免出现20世纪80年代那样具有破坏性的繁荣萧条交替循环的局面。

sentence.Network_en: They will have to bust the door to get him out.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们将不得不撞破门把他弄出来。

sentence.Network_en: Good posture also helps your bust look bigger.
sentence.Network_cn: 优美的姿势也能让你的胸部看起来更丰满。

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 17th cent. (denoting the upper part or torso of a large sculpture): from French buste, from Italian busto, from Latin bustum 'tomb, sepulchral monument'
mid 18th cent (originally US, as a noun in the sense 'an act of bursting or splitting'): variant of burst

entry.def: If you bust something, you break it or damage it so badly that it cannot be used.

example.ex: They will have to bust the door to get him out.
example.tran: 他们将不得不撞破门把他弄出来。

entry.def: If someone is busted, the police arrest them.

example.ex: They were busted for possession of cannabis.
example.tran: 他们因藏有大麻被逮捕。

entry.def: If police bust a place, they go to it in order to arrest people who are doing something illegal.

example.ex: ...police success in busting UK-based drug factories.
example.tran: 警察对英国的毒品加工厂成功实施的突击搜查

entry.def: A company or fund that is bust has no money left and has been forced to close down.

example.ex: It is taxpayers who will pay most of the bill for bailing out bust banks.
example.tran: 是纳税人将支付大部分的账单以解救面临倒闭的银行。

entry.def: If a company goes bust, it loses so much money that it is forced to close down.

example.ex: ...a Swiss company which went bust last May.
example.tran: 一家去年5月倒闭的瑞士公司

entry.def: A bust is a statue of the head and shoulders of a person.
You can use bust to refer to a woman's  breasts, especially when you are describing their size.

example.ex: Good posture also helps your bust look bigger.
example.tran: 优美的姿势也能让你的胸部看起来更丰满。

means.word_mean: 2. a sculpture of the head and shoulders of a person
3. an occasion for excessive eating or drinking;

sentences.sentence: "they went on a bust that lasted three days"

means.word_mean: 2. search without warning, make a sudden surprise attack on;
3. separate or cause to separate abruptly;

sentences.sentence: "The old chair finally fell apart completely"

means.word_mean: 5. break open or apart suddenly and forcefully;

example.en: Nobody's ever accused you of being unwilling to bust hump.

list.explanation: 非常艰苦地、千辛万苦地干(某事)

example.en: I've been busting my ass to get this thing on time. and now they don't want it.
example.zh: 我一直千辛万苦要把这按时完成，但现在他们却不要了。

example.en: l'm finished busting my nuts on that kind of work.
example.zh: 我累死累活地终于把那种活儿干完了。

auth_sentence.content: Lemming populations also undergo periodic boom and bust cycles.
auth_sentence.res_content: Lemming populations also undergo periodic boom and bust cycles.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Lemming populations also undergo periodic boom and bust cycles.

auth_sentence.content: Thousands of farms went bust, whole communities withered.
auth_sentence.res_content: Thousands of farms went bust, whole communities withered.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Thousands of farms went bust, whole communities withered.

auth_sentence.content: We have been advised that ELS has gone bust.
auth_sentence.res_content: We have been advised that ELS has gone bust.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: We have been advised that ELS has gone bust.

Sentence.sentence: The hotel bust (不景气), like most busts, was preceded by a breathtaking boom.

sentences.en: I dropped my camera on the pavement and bust it.
sentences.cn: 我把照相机掉在人行道上摔坏了。

sentences.en: She made a plaster cast of a bust of Lincoln.
sentences.cn: 她用石膏塑造了一座林肯半身像。

sentences.en: Do you have this dress in a bigger bust size?
sentences.cn: 有胸围比这件大些的衣服吗?

jushi.english: He dropped his watch on the pavement and bust it.
jushi.chinese: 他把手表掉在人行道上摔坏了。
